  • Method Details

    • binarySearchByRange

      public ArrayList<Integer> binarySearchByRange(K[] array, K first, K last)
      This function performs a binary search on an array to find elements within a specified range and returns their indices in an ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      array - an array of elements of type K, which is the type of the elements being searched.
      first - The first element of the range to search for in the array.
      last - The parameter "last" is a value of type K that represents the upper bound of the range to be searched in the binary search algorithm. It is used in the method "binarySearchByRange" to find the index of the last occurrence of the element in the array that is less than or equal
      Returns:
      The method is returning an ArrayList of integers that represent the indices of the elements in the input array that fall within the range specified by the input parameters "first" and "last". If no elements are found within the range, the method returns null.

    • binarySearchStringRange

      public ArrayList<Integer> binarySearchStringRange(K[] array, K[] array2, K first, K last)
      This function performs a binary search on two arrays of a given type to find a range of values between a specified first and last value, and returns an ArrayList of the indices of the values found within that range.
      Parameters:
      array - An array of type K (generic type) that is sorted in ascending order.
      array2 - The second array to be searched for the range of values.
      first - The first element to search for in the range.
      last - The parameter "last" is a value of type K, which is the last element of the range to be searched in the binary search algorithm. It is used to determine the upper bound of the range to be searched in the "binarySearchStringRange" method.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an ArrayList of integers. If the input is invalid, it returns null.

    • binarySearchRange

      public int binarySearchRange(K[] arr, K target, boolean lower)
      This function performs a binary search on an array to find the index of a target value, and can also return the index of the lower or upper bound of the range of values equal to the target.
      Parameters:
      arr - an array of elements of type K, which is the type parameter of the array
      target - The value that we are searching for in the array.
      lower - A boolean value indicating whether to search for the lower bound of the target range (true) or the upper bound of the target range (false).
      Returns:
      The method returns an integer value that represents the index of the target element in the array. If the target element is not found in the array, the method returns -1. If the target element is outside the range of the array, the method returns -2.

    • binarySearch

      public int binarySearch(K[] arr, K goal)
      The `binarySearch` method is performing a binary search on an array of elements of type `K` to find the index of a target value `goal`. It returns the index of the target element in the array, or -1 if the target element is not found in the array.
